intro: Lisianthius silenifolius, commonly known as the silverleaf lisianthius, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, pale blue to violet flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
